comments.body: Seems like TS cannot use nullable union types. Is this a spec?
What exactly do you mean by "nullable union types"?

I want to define `DOMPurifyHookEvent: DOMPurifySanitizeElementHookEvent | DOMPurifySanitizeAttributeHookEvent | null` but `null` is removed by compiler. So I actually got `DOMPurifyHookEvent: DOMPurifySanitizeElementHookEvent | DOMPurifySanitizeAttributeHookEvent`. This type doesn't have `null`. How can I add to this type possibility to be `null`?
I'm not sure; under `strictNullChecks` this should just work. Can you send a repro to the TS issue tracker?
I checked that type again then it works fine. Something was wrong. Now there is no problem. Please merge.
